title: Continuous Finance Building Blocks
description: DApp developers want to use financial Smart Contracts in projects, but that requires Plutus engineering expertise, slowing time-to-market.

f6_assessments.q0: A great plan to build modules enabling easier development of finance based Dapps. This will speed time to market for developers whilst also making it easier to debug a single set of core building blocks enabling more confidence in the apps built from them. Awesome to see this will be provided as open source.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has great technical and financial experience and well defined plan, budget and timeline. No reason not to be highly confident of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has a clearly defined set of deliverables which will be easy to audit. They have set some clear definitions for success such as 5 projects using the model.

f6_assessments.q0: Challenge was DApp developers want to use financial Smart Contracts in projects, but that requires Plutus engineering expertise, slowing time-to-market was addressed by creating  a reusable module of bonding curves and SDKs to help developers implement project financing, investment, and collaboration into DApps.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has experience in financial markets software engineering, cryptocurrency payments, tech start-ups, Data & Govtech, impact investing. We are also active in organizing a legal-tech community and the Eastern Townhall. DApp developers working on market opportunities need to move fast and test their market, iterating quickly on designs and approaches. These DApps often require market mechanisms that help fund projects and incentivize user activity. Implementation of the proposal is well underway.
f6_assessments.q2: The key performance indicators (KPIs) is very clear, timeline, milestone and all other information included is very detailed. But, the ability to audit this proposal needs clearer metrics that can be easily viewed to determine if the proposal is successful.

f6_assessments.q0: A slow time-to-market because of a lack of Plutus expertise is a real problem which the proposer team wants to address by creating modules/templates/kits that will simplify the development of smart contracts (especially for the financial sector). With this solution, developers will benefit from this solution and also business in the Cardano ecosystem that can accelerate their go-to-market initiatives. Therefore, this proposal is perfectly align with the challenge setting and the expected impact is high.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is well-known in Catalyst and has already presented some good solutions for the Cardano ecosystem. However, some more personal information would be helpful to understand and assess the capabilities of the team (like references or so). The technical implementation plan is very clear and well written. The architecture of the solution does make sense from my point of view. The approach is based on many references and show a deep understanding of the material by the proposer team. The budget breakdown is clear and the requested amount in relation to the impact is fair and well priced. This proposal has a high chance of a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has presented clear indicators of what success will look like for this proposal. The roadmap is realistic and very much in detail. So it is easy to know what the community can expect to get for this amount of money. A future outlook is given and also the detailed architecture plan is well reflected. A Github is also available and already shows a lot of activity. I think the community can easily audit this proposal (as it is already possible).

f6_assessments.q0: As we know Bonding Curves has many applications in the field of DeFi. I think SDK can help the developers in building DApps. Proposal is up to handle the challenge and can be assessed again after 6 month.
f6_assessments.q1: Team has experience in financial sector and was part of cohort program that is good. Plan can include details about all the 5 products that will be using Bonding Curve after 12 month.
f6_assessments.q2: Overall provided information are sufficient to understand the idea and can be assessed on the basis of this proposal. little bit proposal could be better by adding more details about different products.

solution: A reusable module of bonding curves and SDKs to help developers implement project financing, investment, and collaboration into DApps.
experience: Financial markets software engineering, cryptocurrency payments, start-ups, data & Govtech, impact investing. Organize legal-tech community.
